results.title: Starving Orcas and the Fate of Alaska’s Disappearing King Salmon
results.abstract: With the fish numbers at historic lows, scientists, chefs and others are asking whether we should be eating them anymore, and what it means for the future of all wild salmon.

results.title: Why Did 488 Golden Retrievers Gather in Scotland?

results.title: Facing a Future of Drought, Spain Turns to Medieval Solutions and ‘Ancient Wisdom’
results.abstract: Acequias, a network of water channels created by the Moors over 1,000 years ago, are being excavated and brought back to life to adapt to the crises of climate change.

media.caption: A group of volunteers and workers excavating “acequias” — water channels that were built hundreds of years ago — in June high up in the Sierra Nevada near Granada, in southern Spain.
